Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> staking is actually SUPER EASY for those with unlocked coins.  It will never be easier.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gmoney> when rewards cut to 96 staking will happen on those coins..  And it will be more accessable to all

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> As time goes on, staking difficulty rises with more and more unlocked coins.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> Never thought about only staking. Many lower powered machines that only stake.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> If you have a one core CPU that runs slow as molasses - you can stake.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> I mined 32,000 TZC last Fall.  Have been staking them since - 42,000 now.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> So I have one pair of shared addresses imported on every machine. Any idea how that will work? Should I try to convert everything to separate addresses?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Staked rewards are a constant - just like mined rewards.   When just a few people have staked coins they share 50% of the daily minting of coins.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> @bigtom Before you get rewards, I would delete the wallet.dat files and let Agama create separate and unique ones for your installs.   That's just me.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> This was possible by importing the private addresses before the initial sync finished.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> I tried deleting the wallet.dat. I do not remember if that worked. I will do it though on your recommend.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> especially since I imported them using the multiple feature.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Oh... you can import priv keys all day long.  But there is a store of 'empty' addresses that the wallet creates and if you duplicate the wallet then you will have non-unique addresses.  That could lead to some confusion when you run out of them from what i read here.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> You imported with the multiple import?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Do NOT do that.  If you had transactions on those addresses they will not really import.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> You only lock those out and cannot use them again.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> Some of the wallets have an additional address.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> I will have to transfer my rewards to you and then get them back.ðŸ˜€

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> I would only import actual priv keys from rewards transactions and.... PLEASE just do them one at a time.  TRUST ME!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> If you try to import a reward transaction and it fails to produce the transaction then you will need to go back to a backup of the wallet before you tried the multiple import.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> So far as I know I have no rewards yet. I have to check everything and delete the dat files, right? Thats it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> I would do that.  no rewards - nothing to lose.  Then each box has its own set of keys.  But you can move the blocks by hand until a better way is implemented.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> Do I need a private address?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> I am not an expert on this, but have been messing with this for about 3 weeks and have had some experience with it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> Private Z address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> @bigtom Agama will create all addresses automatically.  Each reward will have its OWN address that is assigned when rewarded.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> But the reward address is tied to the wallet address.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> You will need to download the Z Cash proving keys or something like that.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> The reward addresses are all different.  there is a way with the CLI wallet to set it to a single address, but this is not like mining RVN or ETH or MDEX or whatever.  It is a bit different.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> The wallet will tell you that the Z cash keys have to be downloaded.  Takes a few minutes.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> And, to further complicate things, when you look at the block explorer... you will see a DIFFERENT address to where the rewards were sent...  it is strange.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> 
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/449638035999686677/463922899594510336/unknown.png

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> 
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/449638035999686677/463923040921845760/unknown.png

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> SAME transaction....

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> So the addresses are in the wallet.dat. Deleteing that will clear them out so I can get new ones.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Yes. All of your keys are in the wallet.dat.  If there are no rewards then you are losing nothing.  The wallet.dat is the only file that has the value in it... when you have coins.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> All keys are in it - private and public

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> The math is amazing.  For IOTA, I think there are more private keys than there are atoms in the known Universe...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> WAY more in fact.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> The Z cash proving keys must be somewhere else. I did not have to download them again.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Maybe in your Komodo folder?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> deleted the file and the previous addresses were gone and got a new single address assigned.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> I just need the one address in the receive area, right?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> No.  That address might or might not be used.  The addresses are assigned automatically from a pool that your Agama wallet created when you made a new wallet.  If you create a 'receive' address that is needed when you want me to send you coins, but this is NOT going to be your mining address.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> You CAN make it that way with the CLI wallet, but the GUI version creates addresses on the fly and they are all unique.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Just let the wallet do its thing.  The only thing to remember is this - when you import a Private Key - ONE at a time.  If you have multiple ones to import, import them as singles but on the LAST one set the switch for a wallet rescan so they all show up.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> Ahh . Now I get it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> All of these are different and I did not choose any of them...
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/449638035999686677/463926536844738560/unknown.png

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> I have been importing the receiving addresses to to all the machines.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> That actually could cause a problem.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Unless you did them one at a time..

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> So the mining address in not visible int he GUI.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> The mining address is what it is when you get a reward.  You do not know what it is going to be.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> And you cannot choose it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> Ok . So far no rewards and I am deleting al the wallet.dat files. This is causing a new file to be generated.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Here is what I think happens when you try a 'import multiple priv keys' with the GUI wallet.  The wallet sees the keys and registers then as imported, but the transaction is not incorporated into the wallet FULLY and it does not show up.  However, the wallet THINKS that priv key has been imported so when you try to import it again as a SINGLE priv key... it just sort of says (I think) "Hey... we already did this - go away" and you cannot get that transaction into your wallet.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> You will get new wallet.dat files when you run the wallet again.   Double check to make sure but I am certain this happens.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Once you get a reward... never delete again.  You can move, archive, rename... but never delete again unless there is a clear and expert reason to do so.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> Thanks!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Again... I am not an expert.  I am an old fart a few years from retirement who has a hobby that might help him through the golden years of life.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <oscar> need I open the wallet so many days?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> The process does not depend upon the wallet being open.  The transaction is programmed to mature on the blockchain.  You could shut the wallet down for 5 years and come back in 2023 and the coins will be yours and available.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <dukeleto> It's not for everybody, but I turn the directory containing wallet.dat into a git repo, and occasionally do a `git commit` of wallet.dat. This allows you to "roll back" to a previous version of wallet.dat, if it gets corrupted or whatever, pretty easily. I have used this also when I accidentally mined my own fork of VRSC and I thought it messed up my wallet. You can backup this directory/git repo like any other files
